description: Describes the specified load balancers or all of your load balancers.

parameters.name: LoadBalancerArns
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the load balancers. You can specify up to 20 load balancers in a single call. (string) ---

parameters.name: Names
parameters.description: The names of the load balancers. (string) ---

nested_items.name: LoadBalancers
nested_items.description: Information about the load balancers.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: DNSName
nested_items.description: The public DNS name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: CanonicalHostedZoneId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Route 53 hosted zone associated with the load balancer.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time the load balancer was created.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerName
nested_items.description: The name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Scheme
nested_items.description: The nodes of an Internet-facing load balancer have public IP addresses. The DNS name of an Internet-facing load balancer is publicly resolvable to the public IP addresses of the nodes. Therefore, Internet-facing load balancers can route requests from clients over the internet.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The state code. The initial state of the load balancer is provisioning. After the load balancer is fully set up and ready to route traffic, its state is active. If load balancer is routing traffic but does not have the resources it needs to scale, its state is active_impaired. If the load balancer could not be set up, its state is failed.

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: A description of the state.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of load balancer.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: The subnets for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: ZoneName
nested_items.description: The name of the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet. You can specify one subnet per Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: OutpostId
nested_items.description: [Application Load Balancers on Outposts] The ID of the Outpost.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerAddresses
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers] If you need static IP addresses for your load balancer, you can specify one Elastic IP address per Availability Zone when you create an internal-facing load balancer. For internal load balancers, you can specify a private IP address from the IPv4 range of the subnet.

nested_items.name: IpAddress
nested_items.description: The static IP address.

nested_items.name: AllocationId
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers] The allocation ID of the Elastic IP address for an internal-facing load balancer.

nested_items.name: PrivateIPv4Address
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers] The private IPv4 address for an internal load balancer.

nested_items.name: IPv6Address
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers] The IPv6 address.

nested_items.name: SourceNatIpv6Prefixes
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers with UDP listeners] The IPv6 prefixes to use for source NAT. For each subnet, specify an IPv6 prefix (/80 netmask) from the subnet CIDR block or auto_assigned to use an IPv6 prefix selected at random from the subnet CIDR block.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The IDs of the security groups for the load balancer.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: IpAddressType
nested_items.description: The type of IP addresses used for public or private connections by the subnets attached to your load balancer.

nested_items.name: CustomerOwnedIpv4Pool
nested_items.description: [Application Load Balancers on Outposts] The ID of the customer-owned address pool.

nested_items.name: EnforceSecurityGroupInboundRulesOnPrivateLinkTraffic
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to evaluate inbound security group rules for traffic sent to a Network Load Balancer through Amazon Web Services PrivateLink.

nested_items.name: EnablePrefixForIpv6SourceNat
nested_items.description: [Network Load Balancers with UDP listeners] Indicates whether to use an IPv6 prefix from each subnet for source NAT. The IP address type must be dualstack. The default value is off.

nested_items.name: IpamPools
nested_items.description: [Application Load Balancers] The IPAM pool in use by the load balancer, if configured.

nested_items.name: Ipv4IpamPoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the IPv4 IPAM pool.

nested_items.name: NextMarker
nested_items.description: If there are additional results, this is the marker for the next set of results. Otherwise, this is null.
